intro: Sebastiania ramirezii, commonly known as the Ramirez's sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Belize and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its succulent, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
